content: Again, you serve our community here better by staying with one thread, not starting a new one for each reply. On your issue, I think I understand now. You are wanting the INSERT button on the unified toolbar, but that is not where it needs to be. Please see the two attached screenshots: - one shows the panel for 'account settings' and 'composition & addressing.' On that screen is a text box to check for HTML. Do that. Doing this sets the appropriate menus in the compose panel to show the insert button. - the second screenshot shows the composition panel. The two arrows show two places where you can click when you want to insert an image. Let me know. I want this to work for you. david
creator: davidsk

content:
If you are referring to donating to the non-profit MZLA Technologies Corporation.

From the FAQ on https://www.thunderbird.net/donate/

What are the ways I can give? You can donate online securely by credit card or PayPal, Google Pay, Apple Pay, and by bank transfers through SEPA, iDEAL and ACH. Give in your local currency! We accept over 100! Choose yours from the drop down menu next to ‘Amount’. You can give offline in USD only by mailing a check or money order made payable to "MZLA Technologies Corp". Mail to: MZLA PO Box 25718 Pasadena CA 91185-5718 Please include your email address on the memo line of your check to help us track and attribute your gift. We can only send acknowledgement receipts by email. Give the gift of your time! If you would like to learn how to contribute to Thunderbird in other ways such as coding, translating or testing, please visit our Participate page.

If you still have questions about donating then use this form https://www.thunderbird.net/donate/help
creator: James

content:
Perr poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: Please post the exact text of the message, and someone here may be able to assist. thank you
creator: davidsk

content:
I think you are misunderstanding your current account. "Thunderbird" is a program that runs on your local computer that interacts with your email service (Gmail, Yahoo, Comcast, etc.) There is no "Thunderbird account", that is, there is no Thunderbird email host. Your email address may identify your true email service.

Thunderbird, the program, can hold multiple email accounts. If you decide to subscribe to Gmail or Yahoo or whoever, you can simply add those accounts to Thunderbird. You can then discontinue your old service, or maybe have that email forwarded to your new address (that would best be done at the web mail page for your current service.)
creator: rednoise

content:
I assume you're writing HTML-style messages. Look at the setting:

<Tools | Settings | Composition | HTML Style> and make sure the "Use Paragraph format instead of Body Text by default" option is UNchecked.

You can also switch on a temporary basis while composing the message by choosing a different style from the Style drop-down list in the compose window (usually found on the left side of the Formatting Toolbar.)
creator: rednoise

content: Assuming your question is 'How to access the SMTP server settings', the answer is: - click to 'account settings' pane - click the account name in left sidebar - then, click the 'edit SMTP server' button in lower right of screen.

content:
I'm thinking the Help Desk is steering you wrong. Port 25 is not the standard port for a secure (SSL) connection to an SMTP server. The default port is usually 465. Port 20 is usually only used for an unencrypted connection.

I can't find any official care4free.net help page with suggested settings. I think you should first try setting the port to 465 with SSL/TLS or STARTTLS (try both.) If that doesn't work, try port 25 with no security (this is just for a test, not recommended to keep.) If one of those works, let us know.

(I also found an old post suggesting port 587 "with or without security", so if the above doesn't work, try this.)

This is you email service's problem, not Thunderbird's. In the absence of clear published settings recommended by care4free.net or plusnet, I think you're just going to have to juggle the settings around until you find the right combination.
creator: rednoise

content: By chance did you disable the "Folder Pane" in View > Layout > Folder Pane?

content:
I hope I understand your question. If not, please clarify.

To remove an account from Thunderbird, to to Tools | Account Settings and select the account you want to delete. There is a Delete button in the right pane. It will ask you to confirm, but be aware that once you delete the account, it's gone for good off your computer (though not on the email server, of course.)

See the attached image.
creator: rednoise
